abstracts.cdata!:
The Chongqing Urban Environment Project
            will enable Chongqing Municipality to implement a long term
            program of water resource management, and to recover from
            past environmental degradation of its water and land
            resources. Project components include wastewater management
            and municipal solid waste management; urban water supply;
            water quality monitoring and management; and institutional
            strengthening. Surface water may be polluted as a result of
            leachate discharge at the landfill site. This will be
            mitigated by minimizing the area exposed to air. Wastewater
            produced by construction will be collected and performed
            sedimentation on it before discharge. Air pollution produced
            by gas and dust at the landfill site will be mitigated by
            planting trees to isolate the site. Noise during
            construction will be mitigated by logically arranging
            construction time and selecting low noise equipment.
            Destruction of vegetation during construction will be
            mitigated by planting trees and preventing water and soil
            runoff. The risk of altering traditional soil usage will be
            reduced by reserving the upper layer of the landfill site.
            Using refuse and sludge generated from the sewage plant as
            fertilizer will be considered after an analysis of the
            sludge composition. By arranging pipe projects into
            subsections during construction, the risk of large scale
            soil runoff from the discarded soil will be avoided.
